content.question: Which of the following is the most appropriate bass line for a deceptive cadence in A-flat major?

choices.label: Two measures notated in bass clef, three-four time. Quarter note D-flat3, quarter E-flat3, quarter E-flat2, dotted half note A-flat2.
Two measures in bass clef, three-four time. Quarter note D-flat3, quarter E-flat3, quarter E-flat2, dotted half note F2.
Two measures in bass clef, three-four time. Quarter note B-flat2, quarter C3, quarter D-flat3, dotted half note A-flat2.
Two measures in bass clef, three-four time. Quarter note F3, quarter E-flat3, quarter D-flat3, dotted half note C3.

content.answer: Two measures in bass clef, three-four time. Quarter note D-flat3, quarter E-flat3, quarter E-flat2, dotted half note F2.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
